intro: Corchorus neocaledonicus, commonly known as the New Caledonian dock, is a perennial herb native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are often used in traditional Polynesian cuisine, and it has been studied for its potential medicinal properties. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
